info.prompt: You are a data miner that deals with scientific texts on microbiology and you extract numerical values related with antimicrobial effect. For the text I will input next, output only the numbers associated with minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values indicating the antimicrobial effect. Output the concentration unit (ex: mg L-1) with a blank space after each number found (Ex: '10.1 mg L-1' or '10.1 mg mL-1' or '10.1 g mL-1' or '10.1 ug mL-1'). If no value is found, output 'None'. Do not output concentration values not related with minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC).

('ATC00779', 0).text: The highest antibacterial activity was obtained with bimetallic Ag/Cu nanoparticles with minimum inhibitory concentrations (MIC) of 0.054 and 0.076 mg L-1 against B. subtilis and E. coli, respectively.

('ATC01028', 0).text: The minimal inhibition concentrations (MIC) of GO@CS/ZnO against Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus are only 2.5 ug mL-1 and 5 mg mL-1 respectively.

('ATC01856', 0).text: The antimicrobial effect of 30 and 100 mg l-1 silver nanoparticles were investigated against Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus aureus, Salmonella typhimurium, Enterococcus faecalis, Bacillus cereus, Bacillus subtilis, Paenibacillus larvae, Candida albicans and Aspergillus niger.

('ATC07490', 0).text: The MICs of MK-AgNPs against both MRSA and methicillin-sensitive S. aureus (MSSA) strains were 32 ug ml-1, while for ES beta L-producing E. coli, it ranged from 32 to 64 ug ml-1.
('ATC07490', 0).extracted val: 32 ug ml-1, 32 ug ml-1, 32 ug ml-1, 64 ug ml-1

('ATC09961', 0).text: The minimum inhibitory concentration and minimum bactericidal concentration of amoxyclav were 70 ug mL-1 and 140 ug mL-1, respectively, against Proteus mirabilis and 50 ug mL-1 and 100 ug mL-1, respectively, against Staphylococcus aureus.

('ATC13863', 0).text: The MIC values for liposomal formulations and free VAN ranged from 0.78 to 1.56 ug ml-1 against both tested strains, with no difference in the inhibition of biofilm formation as compared to free VAN.

('ATC14160', 0).text: A cypermethrin utilizing bacterial strain (MIC, 450 mg l-1 was isolated from the soil of pesticide contaminated agriculture field and characterized by using polyphasic approach.

('ATC14857', 0).text: The MIC value of Lam-AuNPs against several drug-resistant microbial pathogens varied from 2 to 1024 ug mL-1 in both standard and host-mimicking media.

('ATC19756', 0).text: The excellent antibacterial activity of the PFDCs achieves lowest MIC values of 40 and 60 ug mL-1 (i.e., 1.4 and 2.2 mu mol L-1 against E. coli and S. aureus, respectively.

('ATC20510', 0).text: The MIC90 of SeNPs against all tested bacteria was 25 ug mL-1, whereas the antibiofilm concentration was 20 ug mL-1 against all bacteria, except B. cereus.

('ATC24627', 0).text: Various in vitro assays confirmed that GOx& HRP@ZIF-8/ASO exhibited excellent antibacterial properties against Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus aureus, methicillin-resistant S. aureus (MRSA) during catalysis of glucose (Glu), especially the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) against MRSA was only 16 ug mL-1.

('ATC25139', 1).text: Co3O4 nanoparticles 2, with a MIC of 2 ug mL-1, has much higher antifungal activity than clotrimale, whose MIC is 4 ug mL-1, against M. audouinii.

('ATC27177', 0).text: The 32 ug ml-1 Cu NPs concentration showed excellent antimicrobial activity against Gram positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

('ATC27218', 0).text: Minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values of 70 and 35 ug mL-1 of the Ag@S-GQDs nanocomposite were found to be sufficient to hinder the growth of P. aeruginosa and S. aureus.

('ATC28930', 0).text: Due to the results, CP-AgNPs enhanced antimicrobial potential against S. aureus, E. faecalis, P. aeruginosa, A. baumannii and E. coli with MIC and MBC of (0.11, 7.1 ug ml-1, (0.11, 1.7 ug ml-1, (0.11, 0.22 ug ml-1, (0.11, 0.22) and (0.11, 0.44 ug ml-1, respectively.

('ATC32445', 0).text: AgNPs indicated significant antibacterial activity against S. aureus and K. pneumoniae fwith a zone of inhibition of 17 and 18 mm at a concentration of 1000 mg mL-1 with minimum inhibitory concentration of 15.6 and 62.5 mg mL-1 respectively.

('ATC34870', 0).text: The in vitro antibacterial assay (100 lg disk(-1) concentration) showed the results of maximum zone of inhibition with the E. coli (18.40 +/- 0.97 mm), and minimum (10.87 +/- 1.33 mm) zone of inhibition with S. aureus but the concentrations of MIC and MBC values ranged between 6.25 and 50.0 ug ml-1 between the selected bacterial strains.

('ATC34927', 0).text: Results also was ascertained that the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) was 25 mg l-1 at 30 min for E. coli and Salmonella enterica, 45 min for Listeria monocyteogens, Staphylococcus aureus, and Candida albicans and 60 min for Aspergillus niger with a noticeable bactericidal impact.

('ATC37015', 1).text: Zinkicide SG6 had a sevenfold to eightfold lower MIC against Escherichia coli and X. alfalfae subsp. citrumelonis (31 to 250 ug ml-1.

('ATC42038', 0).text: Our best analogue 5, showed MICs of 4 ug mL-1 against A. baumannii, E. coli, P. aeruginosa and S. aureus with a hemolytic activity of 47 % against red blood cells.
